Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <UncleRay> is this a cpu only coin?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> for now CPU only. i believe we will soon have GPU miners that are in development. currently they don't look like they will be better than CPUs or support many GPUs in one machine due to bottlenecks. check #cpu-hashrate for CPU numbers to get a feel for CPU speeds, which are the highest in the world on any cryptographic hash algorithm. what I understand is that the GPU numbers are under 140 MH/s for a 1080ti and drop significantly with multiple cards or go into the low 10s of MH/s with risers

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <devpro> @miketout   Is there another exchange?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> not yet. we can work to get on additional exchanges if the community wants to, but the big ones can take a little time. i think digitalprice.io has done a good job for the community so far. i haven't heard many complaints, and those that i did were resolved. imo, additional exchanges should either bring an audience to learn about Verus, which means being a little bigger, or i'm not sure if they help a lot. if the community wants to get on more, we certainly can focus more on that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> hash rate and difficulty are part of the same calculation, basically, hash rate is calculated from difficulty. i just finished putting all the code needed for VerusHash support into nheqminer, which is a stratum miner that can also mine Komodo and Zcash with CPU or GPU. I think once we have pools running with this, we should get a significantly larger hashrate and stronger network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gmoney> @miketout . with some of the locked coins being 2 years and beyond, how are those trnsactions not going to just get burried or lost off the end of the wallet trnsactions? There will be no way of keeping track and seeing when things come mature.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> we are going to make the list able to be much longer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> probably someone will write scripts as well to make it easier over time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <wistar> I've been writing them all down.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> So a GPU miner is being released as well as a cpu miner?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> @Godballz Some people are working on a GPU miner. Release date is unknown.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @Godballz the GPU mining work does not currently beat CPU mining. in tests, they are getting under 140 MH/s on a 1080ti, and risers slow it a lot. the pool miner that I've just written from a fork of nheqminer is benchmarking a bit faster than the wallet on CPU, but there's no GPU support in it yet. I don't know the exact release date of the GPU miner, but I know they are trying to finish soon as well. I'd like to see someone put the GPU support into the nheqminer fork, so people can use both with pools. CPUs are still tops right now, but it looks like they may be able to coexist.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @Gmoney It would also be great to be able to sort the transactions by the 'time to maturity' so we could bring the next blocks to mature to the top of the list.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gmoney> @jimboscott yes!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Gmoney> so something weird this morning.. 
I was right at my computer when a staked transaction was coming in.. 1 confirmation.. 
Then I looked back a minute or 2 later.. It was gone.. I thought I was loosing my mind.. 
Then 2 hours later.. The In and Out reappear and start to recount the confirmations (although the time stamp is still from the 2 hours earlier)
however there is no 'mined' transaction.. 
and there is no balance change.. 
So my staked reward either 1. got sucked into the ether with another glitch in the matrix, or 2. someone else grabbed it???
@miketout thoughts?
